column2: AWS CloudFormation is a service that helps you model and set up your Amazon Web Services resources so that you can spend less time managing those resources and more time focusing on your applications.

CloudFormation works by you creating a template that describes all the AWS resources that you want (like EC2 instances or RDS DB instances), and AWS CloudFormation takes care of provisioning and configuring those resources for you.

column1: What format is used for AWS CloudFormation templates?
column2: AWS CloudFormation templates can be written in JSON or YAML.

column1: Can AWS CloudFormation manage updates to existing stacks?
column2: Yes, AWS CloudFormation can manage updates and dependencies between resources within stacks.

column1: What are stack sets in AWS CloudFormation?
column2: StackSets allow you to create, update, or delete stacks across multiple accounts and regions with a single operation.

column1: What are nested stacks in AWS CloudFormation?
column2: Nested stacks are stacks that create other stacks as part of their operation, which allows you to isolate repeated patterns or components as separate templates and reuse them across different stacks.

column1: Can you use custom resources in AWS CloudFormation?
column2: Yes, you can define custom resources in your CloudFormation templates to extend the functionality of CloudFormation with custom provisioning logic.

column1: What are Change Sets in AWS CloudFormation?
column2: Change Sets allow you to preview how proposed changes to a stack might impact your running resources before you implement them.

column1: How do you secure sensitive information in CloudFormation templates?
column2: You can use AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store or AWS Secrets Manager to secure sensitive information and reference it in your CloudFormation templates.

column1: What command line tool can be used to interact with AWS CloudFormation?
column2: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) can be used to interact with AWS CloudFormation.

column1: Is it possible to import existing AWS resources into a new CloudFormation stack?
column2: Yes, you can import existing AWS resources into a new CloudFormation stack.
